discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is right.
sequence 5 is for source prefix (means all source IPs)
sequence 10 is for destination prefix
NAT syntax is right only on answer - C

Selected Answer: C
When a packet hits an interface within Service VPN (VPN 10 in this question), the packet is forwarded to the NAT-enabled transport VPN (VPN 0) interface with command “nat use-vpn 0”. Other Options do not have this command so they are not correct.

Note: match “source-ip 0.0.0.0” means matching any source IP address so all IPs will be matched and accepted (with “action accept”). Otherwise, all traffic that isn’t matched at sequence 5 will be discarded.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct syntax list (except one typo in nat use-vpn, must be nat use-vpn0).
A is wrong (sequence 5 and destination ip 0.0.0.0 action reject).
B is wrong (source ip 0.0.0.0)
C is wrong (sequence 5 and source ip 0.0.0.0)

questions.question_text: An engineer must avoid routing loops on the SD-WAN fabric for routes advertised between data center sites. Which BGP loop prevention attribute must be configured on the routers to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Solution 1 in below link:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/routers/sd-wan/215992-how-to-avoid-bgp-omp-routing-loop-in-sd.html#anc14

choices.C: same OMP overlay-as on WAN Edge routers of all data centers
choices.A: static routing on all WAN Edge routers instead of BGP
choices.B: same BGP AS between all CE and PE routers
choices.D: same BGP AS between all WAN Edge routers and CE routers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A - IS-IS - 115
B - OMP - 250 and 251
C - IBGP - 200
D - External EIGRP - 170

questions.question_text: Which routing protocol has the highest default administrative distance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
there is no another choice

choices.C: It is represented by a group of QoS policies applied to a WAN Edge router.
choices.B: It specifies a Cisco SD-WAN overlay in a multitenant vSMART deployment.
choices.D: It is a unique collection of GRE or IPsec encapsulations, link color, and system IP address.
choices.A: It is represented by a unique identifier to specify a site in a SD-WAN architecture.

questions.question_text: How should the IP addresses be assigned for all members of a Cisco vManager cluster located in the same data center?

choices.D: in each controller with a /32 subnet

discussion.content:
C is correct
We recommend that the IP addresses of all members of the Cisco SD-WAN Manager cluster be in the same subnet.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/manage-cluster.html
I would say C. In same subnet
